body.p:
Harrodsburg Ky
Aug 5" 1865
Gov Thos E Bramlette & E L Vanwinkle Esq
Secy of State
Gentlemen

This will be handed to you by my special friend A M Sea Esq who was an officer in the army of the late rebellion and who desires your assistance in his application for pardon at the hands of the President of the U S.

I can assure you that such a favour will not be thrown away upon Mr Sea, because in every ^respect^ he is a gentleman worthy your highest consideration and besides he is of that kind of metal that when drawn to our Country by ^its^ "loving kindness" constitutes her main Strength & pride, Your favourable consideration of & prompt attention to this matter will place me under
renewed obligations for your universal kindness to me
